page.title: 15TOURISM
page.content: Quinmoor Farmhouse is a popular venue for foreign and British tourists who appreciate the high standard of 'bed & breakfast' accomodation in such interesting surroundings. The 17th century Fox Inn has been a public house in Broadwell for 200 years. It was owned by the Lord of the Manor or principal farmer. During the morning the field workers would go there for free cider,bread and cheese. Since the breweries bought the pubs 50 years ago, the landlord must sell their draught beers but can supplement trade by selling wines and spirits, providing delicious meals and overnight accommodation. 'The Fox' is the social centre of the village. 'The Horse and Groom' and 'The Fox' at Oddington provide similar facilities.
